title: Quordle today - hints and answers for Saturday, August 19 (game #572)
description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

title: Google may have just canceled its Nvidia-powered gaming Chromebooks
description: Recent developer comments reveal Google recently ended its three Nvidia/Chromebook projects with no explanation.

title: Pixel Watch 2 specs have leaked and color us concerned and intrigued
description: Originating from an official source, the Pixel Watch 2 leak reveals it'll sport a Snapdragon W5 chipset and Android 13.

title: Tumblr changes its desktop layout, now resembles Twitter - but without all the drama
description: Tumblr officially pushed out a new layout interface change that makes it resemble social media giant X, formerly known as Twitter.

title: How Lenovo is seamlessly incorporating foldables and AI into the modern work environment
description:
With foldable PCs enhanced with AI and a boundary-defying rollable 
PC concept, Lenovo is delivering innovative technology that easily adapts to any work style - whether fully remote, hybrid, or on-the-go.

title: Netflix is sending its last DVD rental subscribers an awesome final surprise
description: Netflix's DVD rental service is winding down – and to mark the occasion, it's sending out some bonus 'finale discs' to subscribers.

title: Box office bomb The Flash is coming to Max very soon – here's when you can watch it
description: The Flash, which failed to speed its way to a huge box office haul, is joining Max's movie catalog in late August.

title: Baldur's Gate 3's Auntie Ethel is inspired by developer's real grandmother
description: A Baldur's Gate 3 developer has revealed that one of the game's prominent NPCs is actually based on her own grandmother.

title: Animal Crossing: New Horizons fan who visited all 43 in-game artworks in real life has been “overwhelmed” by the response
description: It took 16 months for Animal Crossing fan May to visit all 43 artworks from New Horizons in real life.

title: Google’s Chrome extensions' safety checks might actually make browsing safer for all
description: In the Chrome 117 update, Google will proactively highlight removed Chrome extensions to improve its browser ecosystem security.

title: Dragon Age writer defends Baldur's Gate 3's Lae'zel, says players are less forgiving to female characters
description: Dragon Age writer David Gaider has defended Baldur's Gate 3 companion Lae'zel.

title: Elden Ring player loses 10 million runes to fall damage after grinding for 2 days
description: One Elden Ring lost 10 million runes to fall damage while trying to complete a brutal challenge.

title: Godzilla set to stomp onto the Vision Pro as Apple TV Plus hints it's making a VR monster series
description: Apple's monster series has reportedly been filmed in "immersive video" for Apple Vision Pro.

title: Your personal info can be stolen thanks to loads of vulnerable web apps
description: A new report has found that a worrying amount of web apps are not secure, putting people's PII at risk.

title: Discover the folding phone that works like Magic
description: The HONOR Magic V2 achieves the impossible through incredible innovation

title: WD is facing a class action lawsuit from users of Sandisk external SSD – here’s why
description: Plaintiffs say the Sandisk Extreme Pro has an undisclosed flaw that leads to sudden failures and data loss

title: Amazon’s new star rating system is so confusing it might hinder my impulse shopping
description: Amazon might be changing the star rating system and I hate that.

title: Hitman devs can't fix the in-game Death Wall
description: IO Interactive has released a new patch for Hitman: The World of Assassination which addresses the "Death Wall" bug with boxes.

description: From brand new action thrillers to gripping courtroom documentaries, there’s plenty to watch this weekend.

title: GitLab has been exploited to launch a novel proxyjacking attack
description: Hackers are selling victim's excess bandwidth for cash and installing cryptominers on computers.

title: Spotify white noise podcasters can make $18k a month – and Spotify may want out
description: Spotify could steer you away from those sleep-aiding, relaxing white noise podcasts to something more… economical.

title: This Android malware avoids detection with a clever trick
description: An unsupported compression method works wonders for crooks looking to hide their malware from antivirus programs.

title: Users of collaboration tool Zimbra have their accounts stolen
description: Someone is sending out convincing phishing emails and stealing Zimbra accounts.

title: Google Messages might soon get a life-saving iPhone 14 feature
description: Google Messages might soon get Android's version of the iPhone 14 Emergency SOS via satellite feature.

title: Skull and Bones closed beta will set sail later this month

title: Microsoft is hosting a Surface event in September – but it won’t be able to compete with iPhone 15 hype
description: Microsoft and Apple are showing off new devices at events in September – but which one will have the most exciting tech?

title: Leaked Nikon Zf images suggest retro mirrorless camera could divide opinion
description: The first leaked images of Nikon's retro full-frame mirrorless camera – the Nikon Zf – suggest it'll be a close relation of the Z fc.

title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 is coming out in November
description: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 releases on November 10, and will contain all 16 launch maps from Modern Warfare 2 (2009).

title: AMD’s graphics cards could crash less often in the future thanks to this new tool
description: Here’s why Radeon GPU Detective could be great news for PC gamers with AMD graphics cards.

description: Authentication specialists Beyond Identity have a new developer tool that can analyze site visitors to see if they're ready for passkeys.

title: iPhone 15 charging speeds could still lag behind the Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra

description: Google's Watch Unlock may soon be enabled, so you can conveniently unlock your phone without a fingerprint or face.

title: iPhone 15 launch: here's how much it could hit the value of your current iPhone
description: We detail how the iPhone 15 launch could affect trade-in prices for iPhone 14, iPhone 13 and iPhone 12 models.

title: Fed up with Microsoft’s default apps bloating Windows 11? We’ve got some good news
description: Want more storage space, and less menu clutter? Extra options are inbound to remove more of Windows 11’s default apps.

title: Microsoft has found a new version of the BlackCat ransomware
description: Some call it BlackCat 2.0, some BlackCat 3.0, and some call it Sphynx. Whatever the name, the malware is dangerous.

title: Suits continues to break records for Netflix and Peacock – and its run might not end soon
description: Suits' impressive popularity continues after it racked up over three billion minutes streamed for four consecutive weeks.

title: Over 200 titles will become unavailable when the Xbox 360 store closes down
description: The Xbox 360 marketplace has announced its closure, which means we will lose access to a huge number of games.

title: Roku has added a ton of free channels from NBCUniversal and more are on their way
description: Local channels including regional news are being added to the free Roku Channel and more are coming.

title: X (Twitter) may implement ID verification to fight impersonators, but will it work?
description: X may soon give Premium users the chance to upload their ID, a selfie, and biometric data to officially verify their identity.
